intro: Pelecyphora aselliformis, commonly known as the hairy pelecyphora, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a compact, low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves that are finely divided. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Pelecyphora aselliformis is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
